prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Now create the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane: 1. Draw the first line segment from the point (0.0, 0.0) to (0.5, 0.0). 2. Draw the second line segment from (0.5, 0.0) to (0.5, 0.625). 3. Draw the third line segment from (0.5, 0.625) to (0.375, 0.625). 4. Draw the fourth line segment from (0.375, 0.625) to (0.375, 0.5). 5. Draw the fifth line segment from (0.375, 0.5) to (0.125, 0.5). 6. Draw the sixth line segment from (0.125, 0.5) to (0.125, 0.625). 7. Draw the seventh line segment from (0.125, 0.625) to (0.0, 0.625). 8. Close the loop and draw the eighth line segment from (0.0, 0.625) to (0.0, 0.0). Afterward, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.625 using 'sketch_scale' scaling parameter. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch by performing a 3D rotation using the specified euler angles in the coordinate system and translating it via the given translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch along its normal direction with the 'extrude_depth_towards_normal' set to 0.75 units and 'extrude_depth_opposite_normal' set to 0.0 units to generate the 3D model. Keep in mind that the shape has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.625 - Height: 0.625</description>

<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[-90.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.625]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.625],"End Point":[0.375,0.625]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.625],"End Point":[0.375,0.5]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.5],"End Point":[0.125,0.5]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.125,0.5],"End Point":[0.125,0.625]},"line_7":{"Start Point":[0.125,0.625],"End Point":[0.0,0.625]},"line_8":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.625],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.75,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.625,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Creating the base part Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the edges are straight. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 Next, draw the 2D sketch on face_1 using the following guidelines: - Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane. - Draw four lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.75] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Notice that there are no circles or arcs, and each loop in the sketch must be closed. Now, scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector obtained from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.75 - Sketch scale: 0.75 Part 2: Creating the rounded corners part Create a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with rounded corners. Begin by creating a new coordinate system using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 - Translation Vector: 0.0075, 0.0075, 0.75 Next, draw the 2D sketch on face_1 using the following guidelines: - Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane. - Draw four lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.735, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.735, 0.0], End Point [0.735, 0.735] - Line 3: Start Point [0.735, 0.735], End Point [0.0, 0.735] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.735], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Notice that there are no circles or arcs, and each loop in the sketch must be closed. Now, scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.735. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector obtained from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.735 - Sketch scale: 0.735 - Operation: CutFeatureOperation (Remove/cut materials from the previous part to achieve the desired final shape)</description>

The prism is centered on the white background.</description>
